BhS_qDZ5t6fTZ-ba078SXA.text: Yummy all day breakfasts, quirky vibe, am always there, open all week no bookings on the weekend

AgjmRhxkfDKKd5Kol2Hp9A.text: Nice atmosphere. It it definitely worth a visit. Me and my friend had a bottle of wine in the outside sitting area, it is very chilled in the evening. Staff was very friendly!

ONpezkRbhFz2C7mGwTkf0A.text: The absolute best food and drinks! Just wish they had a bigger building/more staff so that they could seat more people without queues.

--_o3DgILAl2-dMoB_EVmw.text: i've been to several of the breakfast clubs around london, and have had mixed experiences in terms of food and service. i was nevertheless excited to try out the "secret" bar in the new clapham common/battersea breakfast club with a couple of visiting friends. i'll review the "secret" bar separately, as we ended up having one drink there & then heading through to the restaurant to eat some dinner. being a quiet monday night, the service & atmosphere was great - chilled out, and no screaming children like the review below found (the corridor which leads to the bathrooms seems to back up the fact that it has turned into a yummy mummy meeting point as it was lined up with baby chairs...not for me, thank you)we ordered some buffalo chicken wings to share. i'm a big buffalo wings fan, but i do often find that restaurants do it badly - not so here - they were delicious! it was a good size portion, but I would say for £7 it ought to be. for my main, i ordered the veggie burger. it was a monster! i always just do away with the bun in cases like this so that i can try to eat as much of the "proper" food as possible - that being said, i was still defeated and left all the colesaw and about half of my fries as there was just so much food on my plate. so much delicious food though - let me tell you - it was difficult for me to stop eating those delicious skin on chips!we also ordered some cocktails as they have a happy hour to 8pm (£5 cocktails!). i really recommend the morning mojito which has grapefruit juice in - so delicious.i'll be back here for sure, but only in the evenings when there is less chance of a brood of children disturbing my joy.

94lUCnbb5h638Hj0ooIKRQ.text: Nice and casual spot for food near Clapham park. I've had the breakfast burrito and huevos rancheros and both were fantastic. Staff has great personality and actually interact with you like a person and not just a responsibility. Being on vacation from USA I don't automatically realize the prices of things over here but if I take a sec to do the conversion then this place is on the pricey side. Regardless, it's a dope place to grab a meal.

DRjc-KbyCVyFdd_r2Rtnqw.text: How can you serve a margarita without a salt rim! Food was fine, not amazing, and drinks were the same. Went into The King of Ladies Man for a look but didn't interest us enough to stay for a drink.

TY0C0Dexdh0L88dGHjTKJA.text: What is the fuss about ? You have to wait in a LONG line to be seated and at the end you get a big portion of decent food. Decent ....and just decent. There are other breakfast places in the area who can do it better . This one is a marketing masterpiece. It's OK, no complains from me (ok, one, because of the busy bar our bloodymary arrived in the middle of breakfast (more less 30 min from the order)

I7SjxapCxHth6_zuNoEUUg.text: This Soho brunch institution finally opened a branch south of the river in my hood in May and I only got round to trying it the other week! First impression on walking in were good, loved the retro decor, styled like a 50s kitchen and an 80s laundrette. The staff were friendly, young and hip adding to the general vibe of the place. I was hungover and in dire need of coffee and a hearty brunch to put me to rights. The Breakfast Club did not fail me. They had a really good choice on the brunch menu (as you'd expect) and it was quite difficult to choose but we went for the All American and the Huevos Al Benny in the end. The pancakes in the All American were soft and fluffy and so more-ish. The home-style potatoes with this I'd say are a bit of a carb-overload with everything else included - think we'd happily just have pancakes with bacon next time. Huevos Al Benny - we were drawn to this because of the chorizo, fresh chilli, and avocado with the usual poached eggs, muffins and hollandaise. The fresh chilli added the perfect kick to the smokey paprika chorizo and creamy avocado. A definite must-try for the more adventurous brunchers. We went on a Friday lunchtime and it wasn't too overly busy, but I can imagine it getting packed out and having to queue as in Soho on a weekend seeing as its in prime position on the Battersea Rise strip.

WHK7GFuFfUnGqz_mOzSUlg.text: Came here for dinner last night with a friend, and we were very happy with our meal overall! The one big disappointment was that we expected them to be serving breakfast all day, naturally. Having spent the better part of 10 minutes deliberating over the breakfast part of the menu and finally making up our minds, we then noted the part at the top that says the breakfast bit is only served until 5pm on weekdays. So we then had to start over on the dinner bit. We split a nachos with chili to start, which was outrageously wonderful. We also split an Elvis milkshake - banana, peanut butter and vanilla ice cream. It was fantastic. My friend had an incredible looking sandwich that easily could have fed two people, and I had the 'Cow vs Pig' burger. It was essentially a burger topped with pulled pork. My only regret on receiving it was that they never asked how I wanted it cooked, and I thus forgot to ask for it rare, and it was way too well done. Also the chips that came with it I wasn't a fan of. The coleslaw that came with it was delicious, though! They also needed to keep a pitcher of tap water on the table, as the glasses they gave us for water were minuscule and we had to continually keep asking for refills. The service was super friendly, though, and all around we had a great time and left stuffed. Will be back!

0RK_Ki032_2mU-HLuTEaRg.text: Went here a few months ago when I was down in London for a long weekend, so the morning of my train back up to Birmingham I thought I would fill up on a full English before the train journey (better than a over priced sandwich meal deal lol) The place is set out lovely with different colours all over the place makes the restaurant look really cool.We was shown a table straight away ( first time I have been into a cafe and had to say table for two haha)All the staff were warm and welcoming and was offered drinks straight away.Free wifi was a bonus because my signal was pretty poor in there.I ordered the full monty (no mushrooms!) it was double the price to what I normally pay but I was in London after all.When it turned up my god you don't half get a lot of food for ya dosh haha! It was well cooked and well and truly filled me up for my journey home so top marks breakfast club

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The full monty breakfast club

zt8UHBFDeCC5qzJDh-XChQ.text: We were looking for somewhere local for breakfast and well...this place seemed fitting. The quirky vintage decor and friendly staff were very welcoming. We managed to grab a table outside which was lucky as the place filled up quite quickly. I would recommend getting there early if you don't want to wait for table. I had the Veggie Pancakes with eggs, veggie sausage, home fries, pancakes and maple syrup. Yum! I am slightly obsessed with the savoury food and maple combo. My boyfriend had the Fully Monty and he seemed very pleased with his decision. Overall the meal was very pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The entrance to the Battersea Breakfast Club.

Om20Ym5MOk_YHzHAgAqJZQ.text: Repeating the same formula as their other branches, this place serves big portions of the most yummy breakfast dishes, with a hint of creativity and using quality Ingredients.The breakfast burrito - I absolutely recommend it!Service was efficient. And even at 2pm on a Saturday, there was a queue for a table. Food came out quickly, although at times it was hard to get service. However, this was made up by the fact that they don't add service charge to the bill.

fER9yy6FSe4Y2_dGdRqbmA.text: Great place for breaky/brunch!Its got a quirky, fun vibe!!I had the Hot Chocolate with cream/mallows and the Eggs Benedict, both were delicious, my partner had the Full English Breaky, complete with maple syrup! No complaints, great breakfast!

u9-64x9HCtuiLtL7AKTHDw.text: I went here with a particularly bad hangover and quite frankly was saved! The tea is in a big enough mug to revive you and it has all the breakfast carbs one could ever need! I had the pancakes, they saved my life.

2pCJQ1TvXcmwq-itWc_jZw.text: I went there for a brunch and it was soooo good !I recommend the Full American Breakfast : the pancakes were fluffy, the bacon crunchy and the maple syrup tasted like heaven.I can't wait to go back to try something else.Just one advice : if you're very hungry, do not take the Eggs royale, that are very small.

GN6mU0_PazOxqiZfiOg1Eg.text: Came here for a late night Saturday meal and I think A-ok hits the nail on the head with this place.The server was really nice and the place itself is ok if a little odd.For 9pm on a Saturday it was very quiet and annoyingly they didnt have 3 or 4 things from the menu. In the end I went for the fish finger sandwick, beer batter on the fish was nice - consistency was nice, chips were ok. But all just a little average.

etlMtNXYnZPhdhOIdhDr9w.text: I absolutely love it here! The breakfast is so amazing I went back two days in a row. It is one of the few places in London that I have found that serves iced coffee and iced tea (that tastes amazing). The first time I went I had the breakfast burrito and the eggs were so fluffy and the chorizo tasted amazing. The second time I went I got the huevos rancheros. It was definitely the closest thing to real Mexican breakfast since I've moved to London. The atmosphere in the restaurant is so great and the music is on point. The service was more like an american restaurant than a British one. Also the full Monty is delicious and worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. the full Monty
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

H3XS251XT6oN5Sf97ffDqA.text: The Breakfast Club is great breakfast option close to the Clapham area! They have typical all-American breakfast including large portions. During busy times, the wait time is quite long. However, we planned to come on an off time and had no wait. Whoot whoot.I had the half monty which is was plenty of food and quite filling. I was shocked to see that "bacon" meant a ham like item which was ok. I tried my friend's pancakes and they were fluffy and light. He had the full monty and raved about it.The atmosphere is pretty fun and we sat next to fun washer/dryer units. The service is also decent.This is totally worth trying and I understand there are many of these locations throughout London. Just be careful... around busy times, the line goes out the door and around the side of the building. This is a testament to how good this place is.

fLornJkcly1C0z_a90VQog.text: Go here expecting a queue, it is unavoidable, especially on Saturday or Sunday!  The food is good, the service is friendly.  The blueberry type smoothie was really good.  If you are really hungry go for additional options, as I ordered eggs benedict and it wasn't all the filling.  If you are in the area and have time to wait, then this would be a good option for you.

Sx4WEkh2iHCpthR6F48_Yg.text: I mean - when you've got the regency café doing the same breakfast for much much cheaper and much much better you ought to buck up your ideas!!! the sickening thing was seeing a queue outside this place on a sat morning.....I thought why don't you support local cafe's that are cheap and better!!!!

DC0N0tuu-AmdfoRGpEyR6g.text: Morning Mojito! Morning Mojito!During our London week end to visit our friend who lives very close by, and despite the very long line we had breakfast there twice. The menu is so interesting and there are so many options! I would say that you should totally give it a try, and then most likely you will come back the day after.

UfWLHE2FKFmMgv3qZcAXjg.text: The Huevos Rancheros was really good complimented by an adequate amount of guacamole, cheese tortilla and spicy sausage done perfectly. Eggs were an ideal sunny side up too. I would recommend to anyone looking for a brunch option wanting a fun atmosphere and music spicing up the wee hours.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. the back bar island, great for a group!

TDqm1peca_fpcTGsJC5DvQ.text: I have only been to the "pop up" breakfast club before and thoroughly enjoyed it! So have been waiting for a perfect time to go back and enjoy the legendary huevos al benny, which trust me; is a mouthwatering taste sensation! So after patiently waiting weeks for the crowds to clear we walked past one day surprised to see no queue.Seated in the outside area with great people watching views we were set and excited for my huevos. Unfortunately/annoyingly little did I know the menu changes at 5pm. Even though it was 4:45 they said the menu had changed and the waiter was unwilling or showed no sympathy towards my plea for the huevos al benny . So we had a moment to regroup and think what we were going to eat instead... 15 minutes passed!! and it seemed the waiter had clocked off and was tucking into his dinner on a table nearby! Another waitress came to serve us who was far friendly and even brought us some free water. We ordered with her instead slightly miffed about the wait, but we did have great people watching potential so it kinda went quick.In the end I had the burrito, which tasted amazing and was quickly demolished! I thought the side was a bit of a let down. It was a tiny bit of lettuce covered in an all be it great tasting sauce. MORE please, I'm a hungry boy so needed something just a little bit more substantial.I would come here again before 4:45 if there were not so big a queue just to get stuck into my huevos al benny. The hand dryer in the bathroom COULD be better than a dyson handryer!  Big call I know but it is pretty special! Let me know your thoughts.

h8CmW2Rf-4AjR2Pk0cAOZg.text: Great place to come for breakfast with a nice atmosphere. The coffee is good and the service is friendly.I went for the full English, which really hit the spot and my friend had the Huevos Al Benny, which gave me food envy... I'll definitely be back

rBFStoXwZSAmICS3jVtI0A.text: 5 of the brightest, most well-deserved Yelp stars goes toTBC for their pie and mash entrees. £10 for a chicken tarragon meat pie and mash dish, or you can go the other route and get a veggie and goat cheese sweet potatoer mash pie. Either way, you'll be drooooolinggggg.I'll be. Amazin.

fuCOZdvJ3INyS6jrrYGeZw.text: Cute breakfast spot with a fun vibe. Go during the week to avoid the crowd.

8HNZlH0Yp9x8jNadwOJO_w.text: As usual great food (great can be used in all senses as I didn't have dinner that sunday...). The little slice of east London meets williamsbourgh planted in the middle of Clapham is always a good place to go with friends and family. Very child friendly and lots of space. The staff is wonderful as always so definitely a joy to visit, whenever you get up early and beat the 30 people queues of colourful hipsters outside! No offence - I'm a sympathiser.

SZ-j5RzgWnpAoijAdEqILw.text: Nice place to grab a late breakfast or 'brunch' with an extensive Americana style menu. Prices can be a little high but you do get your monies worth.Just be prepared to wait in line as it gets pretty busy.

dodLzmkQAb1rjq2XL0gh4Q.text: Went here for dinner last night and loved the ambiance. Granted, brunch is also my favourite meal of the day, so the fact that it's served all day is pretty freaking fantastic. Enjoyed the eggs Benedict (although the muffin was a little tough to cut through...) and treated myself to a hot brownie with ice cream for dessert that was just melt-on-your-tongue delectable!

TGXn2RdiDJrCD7Wc_JoIQQ.text: Good points:- food was good - service was quick- lots of variety on menu- accurate American breakfast- got a table immediately - enjoyable open atmosphereThings they could work on:- table service - we ended up going to go get our own drinks, and remind them of our orders- wasn't quite clear who to ask for drinks. We had 3 or 4 different people coming to our table which was kind of confusing.

5MvebuUAb_LeiwbAnJQ7LA.text: Since I love their Borough Market location, I had to try this one. It was a nice day so there were people sitting outside, windows open and no queue which was perfect. Same menu and large selection although we came in time for lunch there is still all day brunch available. I went with the burrito that comes with your choice from three fillings, which I got the fried chicken. It came as a gigantic serve with salsa, beans and peppers. My companion got the waffles topped with chorizo, veggies and chimichuri. We both shared some chips which were just ok.Both of us thoroughly enjoyed our dishes, having the same great taste as their other location. Condiments on the table or can get anything else you need. In addition I ordered a salted caramel shake which was perfect, thick and yummy! It was topped with caramel popcorn although I was relieved it was not too crazy like the freak shake style.Ambiance was about the same, bright and colourful but not too gawdy. Music was fun. Service was a bit slow as we waited awhile for our food and then after they cleared the table did not ask us or bring the bill until we requested it. Normally they would need the table faster. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Salted caramel shake
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Waffles topped with chorizo and egg
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Burrito with fried chicken

b5JnAJSZY18ryX8F6tOYSQ.text: I love this place! Amazing coffee, fantastic service; clean and with wonderful music. I've eaten here a handful of times and every dish is always brilliant. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The Breakfast Club is amazing! Much better than the movie :)

QWJB_WT3VLt0AOfuXlIVrQ.text: Just landed in London and my cousin decided to take us to this spot. It was literally up the road from my aunt house. The drinks are good. We had wings and nachos. I will definitely come back for the food because my cousin raves about it. This place will definitely see me again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

44T7NV2E1eFKTMppYqk5pw.text: Deeeelish!! Many options on the menu for breakfast and lunch, but breakfast is served all day. We went at around 12:30 PM and all got breakfast menu items (read: eggs!)My friends got the eggs florentine with a side of smoked salmon and avocados, and I got the vegetarian All-American: scrambled eggs, pancakes, a big grilled mushroom, potatoes, and a weird vegetarian sausage. I was weary of it at first but it was so so good. Not to mention, great coffee. The seating is quirky and fun, definitely worth a visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

aEw1hY0vRXTAcd7s9bwUng.text: Great burger but I could buy the fries at the store I think, in the frozen area ...Happy hour for cocktail is really nice if you want to start early

9I0-t9WjyOYyz87PZVp4tg.text: I've been for a coffee in a couple of the other branches before and have been waiting for an excuse to have a Breakfast Club brunch for ages ...  luckily no queues on a random Wednesday mid-morning, but the cafe was still surprisingly well attended - don't people have jobs to go to?!The menu is completely overwhelming and I decided to go for the most filling sounding option I could spot - chorizo hash browns with fried eggs!!  Somehow I expected the creation to look somewhat different from fried potatoes with sausages on the side - pre-sliced chorizo just makes a lot more sense, the skin on these was really touch and spoilt the enjoyment.  The fruit salad I ordered as a healthy antidote was nice and fresh - but sadly didn't arrive before the fry-up as ordered.  Summing up, it is the service that lets down the Breakfast Club, if it's this haphazard on a Wednesday, how do they cope at the weekend?!Still, the overall concept and vibe of this chain is fun and funky, and I'll try and find another excuse to visit one of the other branches - I'll opt for one of the less oily breakfast options next time ...

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo hash brown - the healthy option

T-C1uwnbeKWEtvo0cruiiA.text: Yum! Try the blueberry smoothie. It was delicious. I had scrambled eggs which was good. There are so many options for brunch really! I want to go back and try some other stuff.The queue is a bit annoying so keep in mind you may need to wait for a while. The atmosphere is cool and very vibrant. The music is loud so don't expect to be chilling out at this place!

5j68M3bEbjiY_IzhM5c6qQ.text: I really liked it and I would definitely come back. The shabby style is cool and the light that comes in just great for a lingering morning. Very friendly staff!The cons: music a bit too loud for my morning taste (but that's me), the pancakes tasted a bit much of flour, maybe were not properly cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Al Ben! Avocado, chorizo and chilies, what's not to love!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Lovely ambiance
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Big pancakes!

p2bwBaQVceMRQWTmwjTPNw.text: Out waitress was the sweetest and nicest woman. We are from out of country and she made some nice suggestions of where to go and what to do. The food was very good and I enjoyed everything on my plate. My fiancé also enjoyed the meal he ordered. They were fast and good. I highly recommend this place.

AiePVvITCgPj9TgsatHXgg.text: We found this place via Yelp. Since we were just visiting and staying in the area we decided to come here. We decided to get the English breakfast, which was pretty good I would say (better than the one we had the day before) Food is fresh and tasty. Service is good as well.

gQoIjlP-0GMMHFSSUBjj5g.text: A line seemed to popped up literally out of nowhere at about 9:30-10am. I'd advise you to turn up earlier than this if you want to walk in for a table and have a wait of less than 10 minutes.I tried the pancakes with bacon and found it to be alright but not amazing. This was due to most of the syrup ending up over the bacon rather than my pancakes making the bacon far too sweet for my liking and the pancakes dry without the syrup. The potatoes however were a saving grace of the meal and I polished the side dish I ordered of them off quick smart and wished I had just ordered a few more round of those instead. My tea arrives in a mug meaning serious business and no faffing about with mini cups, teapots and milk jugs which I appreciated.The interior has a lovely diner feel to it and it a pleasant location to spend time with friends over breakfast/brunch catching up. I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Mug of tea.

xBqaSWHPABeE38XNsV-wMw.text: Big fan of the breakfast club soho & the one by Liverpool st.  Even though it was dinner time we'd thought we'd give this spot a try for since dinner was on the menu anyways.  Was a lazy Sunday and this must have carried over to the staff as although friendly enough they were slow to even greet new customers to their tables.  When the food eventually came was pretty uninspired and laced much flavour.  Buffalo wings were large but arrive luke warm and pretty much cold after a minute or two.  The chicken wrap wasn't much to shout home about.  We should have stuck with the breakfast in the morning and avoided anytime after. Shame.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

o9xgq0_CG_i19vPv9DM_jA.text: I'd been waiting what seemed like ages to not only experience a Breakfast Club but also one closer to me than somewhere in the east. Finally. My time has come. My expectations were met and exceeded. I had the vanilla latte which was sweet but not to much and it was a nice caffeine burst. I had the Huevos Al Benny which is like a Huevos Rancheros vs. Eggs Benedict. Chorizo, eggs, and peppers atop of an english muffin. I also had a side of Spinach which was delicious. Early grey tea to bring my morning buzz back. Pros:The food was great. The waitstaff were attentive and super niceAmbiance - first day of opening... stil working on it a touchThe price was on the higher side, but then again, the quality of breakfast food is also elevated. Balances out. cons:I know this sounds weird, but i got confused as to where to enter. I think I'm in love.______________________________________________UPDATE! One week later to the day of the opening. I spoke too soon, I'm out of love. At this point we're not even speaking anymore. \Here's the deal breaker. Bad service and babies. Lots and lots of babies in the AM. I can't handle screaming children who aren't disciplined enough or naturally quiet enough to handle being out in public. Dont get me wrong, I actually like kids, I just don't like screaming ones in multiples of 3 that outnumber adults. That I don't like. its turning into a place for yummy mummies and daddies to congregate and commiserate.Now to the service. I was one of 2 people in the place and my tea, its just hot water really... made the 8 feet in about 10 min. seriously. i'm the only paying customer there.  There was a complaint from a near by customer with the same grievance. Maybe someone was hungover... that I understand.. but I still don't care, mama wants her TEA. Speaking of tea, it was burnt and nothing special. Oh where did we go so wrong?

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Benny
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla late
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

PFZ7t2DmmQh-QXgNBl8pMg.text: We had a mixed experience. We ate here yesterday and had a pretty good breakfast of the Veggie Reggie, Artichoke and Sun Blush Tomato Hash, and Butternut Bubble and Asparagus, but were disappointed with service and food today. Although it was much quicker service, the food and end service was a let down. We had Pancakes & Berries, the Veggie All American and Home-Made Granola. The "vanilla cream" for the pancakes was a grossly huge pile of separated sweet-cream butter with some powdered sugar and syrup. It was so gross to put that pile of butter on top and call it a vanilla cream. My daughter got sick after breakfast and I suspect it was from trying to eat that gross "vanilla cream" on the pancakes. The pancakes were very heavy but had a nice taste on their own, but that could have been from the dusting of powered sugar on top of the dish, which added a nice sweetness. The veggie American was not very good. I made the mistake of not tasting the syrup before pouring it on my cakes. The maple syrup tasted like it was some kind of sorghum syrup that has a bitter finish which was also an unpleasant surprise. I think this was masked by the powdered sugar on the Pancakes & Berries dish. My bottom cake was soaked with moisture from the watery onions put on top of the potatoes and undercooked scrambled eggs. As for the eggs, after eating what I thought was an over-seasoned top layer of scrambled eggs, I realized from the absence of any pepper that the eggs just had seasoning on the top so it was bland eating anything under the top layer. My daughter had said the eggs were over seasoned yesterday and it only dawned on me that she experienced the same thing. At least that was consistent. I only ate the top layer of eggs since I didn't want to risk sickness from eating undercooked eggs. The potatoes that I liked so much yesterday had a lot of wet onions laid on top of them which made them soggy (and the pancake below taste like onions). The mushrooms which were so flavorful from roasting were steamed/boiled today and a rubbery texture and unpleasant flavor.The granola was merely okay but the spiced plum compote on the menu was replaced by very tart berries. This doesn't mix well with the already tart yogurt. Finally, it was bewilderingly long to get our change, which we finally gave up on to catch our car. We watched the person walk to the kitchen then back around to the basement then to the register carrying our bill. I walked over to her to get my change since the rest of my family left to get the car but instead she stopped with cashing our check to deal with somone's wayward child and have the waitress give them their check instead of finishing with ours. I was so irritated that I told her I wasn't waiting any longer for our change as we had a car waiting and thanks for nothing. On it's face, it doesn't seem to be hard to give change from 30.00 for a 29.19 bill.  Surprisingly here, it took a trip to the kitchen, basement, and register and it still couldn't be accomplished at the register. I'm glad we had a good meal yesterday but will not try them again.

gl0O295hI6m2beZx8ubYgQ.text: These guys specialise in brunches and doing it right! A bit of a local institution and is regularly queued out on the street while waiting on tables! You can eggs anyway you like them, pancakes with everything, smoothies, milkshakes, coffees and the best freshly squeezed orange juice. These guys are good at what they do and do it well. Only negative was that the service was a bit slow as it was so busy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs, avocado, chorizo & chilli! Yum!

2-6VH-QyOqVZEEIme0ggNg.text: I was "All Ameri-fan Brekkie" happy on pan cake day! The mixture of savoury and spice, from the sausage and potatoes, coupled with pancake and syrup, with the addition of the creamy scrabble was divine. Also, the service was quick and polite , the American diner theme definitely added to the experience. I look forward to going there again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Hotty-choccy-melicious
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. I was "All Ameri-fan Brekkie" happy on pan cake day!

dwkIBjE-uzxG4DEg_zKfSQ.text: The food is quite average for a place you need to wait outside for 40 minutes on the average.My partner had Benedict royale and I had the allamerican both dishes could have very easily been made at home with the same or similar taste.We won't be coming back here.

_gsVME3NBYymbPfCbhDgew.text: I had such a great time playing bingo at BC last night! Anne Hiking is such a lovely, sweet, funny, welcoming host - we wanted to put her in our pockets and take her home she was so cute!! It's a fun night (probably made more so by happy hour wine and cocktails, and me winning the first game to the tune of a pancake breakfast for two!).The decor in the cafe is good, kitsch fun and the size of the bingo game is kept to a good amount that gives everyone more of a chance to win. By a fluke it was all girls last night so the game took on a definite girl power air, with one of the poor waiters being singled out for special attention from Anne (he took it well!)I had the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and skin on chips - so yummy and only a tenner! And then after the games had finished and we'd had our food and drinks, we took our receipt 'next door' (through an internal door that lead through a 'laundromat' to a cute, cheap little bar) and got half price cocktails there! Such a fun night and we will be doing it as often as possible. Long live bingo, long live evenings at the Breakfast Club(but not so much the huge queues for breakfasts on a weekend).

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Made a new friend
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The laundromat that leads to the bar...

3nIv_z05mhudx2uTnL7F-A.text: For my first visit to The Breakfast Club I made the incredibly poor decision of going on a rainy Saturday, after having spent the evening (and early hours of the morning) prior at Fabric - but that's another review entirely.So while I was aware of the ABSOLUTE FACT that I would have to wait in a line, I really should have forced my hungover brain to give a little more consideration to the wait. Alas I did not, but it's ok, I did survive to tell this tale.The staff were very attentive offering (The Breakfast Club-branded) umbrellas and free hot chocolates to those of us queued outside. And the hot chocolate was so good I opted for a full-size version as soon as I got to the table - with marshmallows, naturally.The wait was about 20 minutes, so nothing unbearable, but we did manage to cut it a little shorter by teaming up with another table of two and sharing a table for four instead.The decision on what to eat was pretty simple - it was the All American Breakfast all-round, with a side of French Toast to share. The French Toast was slightly unnecessary in terms of portion sizes, but did I mention my hangover?I loved everything on the plate, and while I had mentally prepared myself not to expect the food to come out too quickly there was no need. The table and food service were super efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate. Pacman cup.
